Show HN: Scan QR codes to check-in guests registered via Google Forms™
description:
Hi HN!

I made a no-code platform for creating physical data collection apps, using QR codes [1]. It does not yet have a self-service config UI though, which limits adoption.

That's why I recently released a Google Forms™ add-on for QR code check-in, based on the platform. This focused use-case makes it easy to provide a fully self-service config UI.

How it works:

1. Create your Google Form as you normally would [2]

2. Activate the add-on if you hadn't already [3]

3. Craft a confirmation email to be sent to each form responder

Upon each form submission, the add-on will send a PDF with a unique QR code (a V4 UUID) to the responder.

Have guests present this code at the event, and record check-ins in bulk using the included QR scanner.

See here [4] for more information, or try the Google Sheets™ version [5] (which doesn't send email).

[1] https://admin.trak.codes/

[2]

Web Development History – Internet history for the technically curious
Ask HN: Why is my web server being attacked?
description:
I run a small Web server. It's a vanity project, very low traffic - less than 50 pages served per day. Strictly HTML - no CGI, no PHP, nothing. For the past couple of weeks the server has been the target of a SYN Flood attack. Also very low volume - 100-150 SYN packets (with forged IP addresses) received per hour. I have all the usual mitigations in place and the attack is not affecting the server. However, I am curious why it's being attacked. I have not received any "ransom" email, the server does not host anything that is even mildly controversial and the forged IP addresses are always different and from all over the world so I'm not being used to flood some other server. Can anyone suggest a purpose for this attack?

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=38785206

Points: 5

Tell HN: Hacker News dataset on BigQuery hasn't been updated since Nov 2022
description:
As you might know, there is a hackernews dataset on bigquery [1]: "This dataset contains all stories and comments from Hacker News from its launch in 2006 to present."

I was going to do some data explorations with this data, but when I sorted the records by timestamp, I noticed the latest items belong to 2022-11-16 and the dataset hasn't been updated since then [2].

[1]: https://console.cloud.google.com/marketplace/product/y-combinator/hacker-news [2]: https://imgur.com/a/w8kg8CW

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=38781031

Points: 5

title: Ask HN: Should I medicate my ADHD?
description:
I was diagnosed with ADHD as a child but have gone unmedicated my whole life. While there have been definitive obstacles to overcome, I’ve always thought of my ADHD as a superpower, as I have the ability to intensely hyperfocus and get incredible amounts of work done.

BUT lately I’ve been wondering. Have I been working harder than I need to? Should I give medication a try? Curious if anyone else here with ADHD has insight. I don’t want to lose my flame but maybe I need some help. Not sure.

Comments URL: https://news.ycombinator.com/item?id=38780642
